definition: lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
(negative prefix)/not/no
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.

sentences.english: The centurion replied, "Lord, I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.
sentences.chinese: 百夫長回答說，主阿，你到我舍下，我不敢當。

sentences.english: He said that he really didn't deserve they should be so kind .
sentences.chinese: 他說他們對他這樣好他確實不敢當。

sentences.english: I dare you to speak to my face.
You're too nervous to tell her face to face.
sentences.chinese: 你緊張得不敢當面向她表白。

sentences.english: Therefore I did not presume to come to you.
sentences.chinese: 因你到我舍下，我不敢當。

definition: original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
bad egg/scoundrel/bastard
to act recklessly/to mess around
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to boast
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
modest/self-deprecating
omnipotent
rampant/unbridled/arrogant/aggressive
